entry.title: How to calculate tax for delivery cost condition type in PO
entry.content:
Hi,

     We have scenario like In PO material cost is 120, then Packing cost is 20 and Tax is 18%. In PO Tax is only calculating on Material cost 120 = 21.6 its not calculating for Packing Cost 20. So total amount of Po is 161.6 but it should be 165.2. Kindly provide a solution. I have attached the Pricing procedure.

entry.title: Purchasing BOM
entry.content: We have a situation where we need to place a PO for 2 items, but only on one item would be picked up by MRP. Normally on the PO we would indicate the second item as a text information, but the supplier doesn't accept it. We need to make sure that both items would be on the PO. Is there any functionality in where you can connect items?

entry.title: SAP MM Cerificate selection
entry.content: I’ve completed my SAP MM training using learning materials, but I’m unsure which certification to pursue since SAP has introduced many updates recently. Could someone please guide me on selecting the right SAP certification exam for SAP MM?

entry.title: Issue in Refurbishment Process with EWM while Goods Issue for Damage material
entry.content:
Hi,

We are currently implementing the refurbishment process using SAP EWM and have encountered an issue related to delivery types during Goods Issue.

Process Overview:

  • Split valuation is activated for the material.

  • A Purchase Order was created for the NEW valuation type material, and the stock has been successfully uploaded.

  • The NEW valuation type material was issued to production.

  • During the production process, the material got damaged, and we now need to issue the DAMAGED valuation type material back to the warehouse/store.

  • A maintenance plan order was created using IW31.

Issue Faced:

When attempting to perform a Goods Issue for the order, the system displays the following error

"Different delivery types DIG DOG not possible in one document"

Request for Support:

Could you please advise:

  • If there is any mistake in the process mentioned above?

  • What is the correct way to issue damaged material from production to warehouse/store under the DAMAGED valuation type?

  • Are there any specific configurations (e.g., movement type to delivery type mapping, valuation type handling in EWM) that need to be checked or updated to resolve this issue?

 

Thanks You

entry.title: Supplier Return Process in SAP S/4HANA Public cloud
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

Why is there a need to create a purchasing info record before a supplier return process can be carried out in SAP S/4HANA public cloud (as this is a prerequisite). If this isn't done, the system would be able to generate an outbound delivery ID which would be used for the picking and GI processes.

Can anyone help out with this.

Thanks in advance

entry.title: RF password is flashing (Revealing the letters) before turning into **
entry.content:
Hi All, 

The password field is revealing before changing itself into **. 

I have used used below in the HTML template but its not working. We are on ECC 6.6

`<input type="password" style="-webkit-text-security: circle;" readonly="readonly" tabindex="-1" `

Any workarounds or sample codes, greatly appreciated. Thanks.

-Srinivas

entry.title: Update work center with new activity type using different UoM - MTN vs L
entry.content:
Greetings of the day PP Experts,

Requesting to share your expertise to understand, when we change/add new Activity type to an existing work center with different Unit of Measure (UoM) and also please help me to understand how it impacts the routing and other dependent workflow like any exiting planned or prod orders.

Actual scenario is there is a work center (Ex: ABC1122) which is being utilized with only 1 activity (Ex: ABC111) with UoM as MTN (Metric Ton). Now, the requirement is changing the Activity type (Ex: ABC121) with UoM as L (Liters) this with effective 3rd Quater (let say from June month) and stop using the current activity type (Ex: ABC111).    

Here, I want to understand if I make changes in work center by adding new activity type (EX: ABC121) with different UoM (liters).  Is there any impact on exiting routing & Planned /prod Orders? 

I recommended to set up a new work center with new activity type and use it effective June. However, my client is requirement to use the same work center and requesting to change the activity type. 

I have traced out there are 6 routing currently using this work center (ABC1122) with t-cde: CA80. when I try to add activity type with UOM as L in work center. I am getting below error at routing level "Enter a unit for dimension Mass for the standard value XXXXXX". 

Prior to posting here I have gone a few blogs and similar scenarios in our SAP Community however I didn't find the relevant one. 

Requesting the PP experts to share your inputs on the impact if we use the same work center by changing the Activity type.

entry.title: Goods Receipt Cancellation for Inbound delivery
entry.content:
Hi Team,

             We have scenario, where STO process is done. GRN has been posted with respect to Inbound delivery. But when we reverse the GRN material document, We are facing 

"Return delivery qty greater than previously GR-posted qty: 180000109/900001

Message no. VLA319"

STO PO created with one line item with 2 kg

OBD created with One line item with 2 kg

PGI created with split batch 001 1kg and batch 002 1kg

Background Inbound delivery is created

GRN has been posted with respect to Inbound delivery.

Due to some issue when we tried to reverse the GRN, we are getting the above error.

Kindly suggest any solution.

entry.title: How to Link Multiple Raw Material Sources to One Finished Product in S/4HANA
entry.content:
We have a finished product called Hummus BIG 1KG, which we sell in 1kg consumer packs. This product can be produced from various raw material sources such as Hummus Big RUS 25kg, Hummus Big CHN 50kg, and so on. The selected source depends on availability and quality control at the time of procurement.

We’re looking for a solution in SAP S/4HANA that allows us to:

  1. Connect all these source materials to the Hummus BIG 1KG finished product, so that demand planning reflects the total requirement for this product – regardless of the supplier or origin.

  2. When creating an RFQ for Hummus BIG, the system should automatically present all available sourcing options (based on different origins), enabling the procurement team to easily compare and choose the most suitable supplier.

  3. At the same time, the production team should have a clear overview of the total demand for Hummus BIG 1KG, without needing to analyze each supplier variant separately.

entry.title: SAP PP MRP- System behavior same with & without Stock Transfer Special Procurement Key in Material
entry.content: Scenario - I have a BOM in plant  X for material H123 which has a component G123. The component G123 is produced in plant  Y and transferred to plant X using STO. In my understanding in such cases G123 in Plant X has to set up with Procurement type F & Special Procurement for Stock transfer from Plant Y to Plant X . But it seems the scenario is fine without the SPK being set up ....the MM master like Info Record , STO set up is there. So my Q then is what is the use of SPK functionality in such a scenario when it behaves similarly with and without SPK for Stock transfer in the material master set up for G123 . Can you please help explain ?

entry.title: Duplicate item position when performing GR from PO
entry.content:
Hi community,

it's about FIORI app "Post Goods Movement" and perfoming GR from PO. When user first enters PO number, item line from PO is displayed. So far so good. But then user enters delivery note number and item line is duplicated. But it's only one position in the PO.

What can be the reason for that issue?

Thanks, Zoran

entry.title: Block shipment for certain time
entry.content:
Hi Community, 

within my organisation we are looking for a function to block material for shipments within a certain time period. In detail the process should be supported as follows. 

1. Material will be produced and backflushed to an HU-managed storage location.

2. Stock should be blocked for shipments and using in delivery notes (e.g. no shipment possible for 2 weeks)

3. After a specified period material will be unblocked automatically and can be used for shipments

Would be great if somebody will have an answer or SAP solution for us.

BR

Andreas

entry.title: Outbound Delivery Not Triggered After Partial Task Confirmation via ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m currently working on a use case where we aim to automate the creation of an outbound delivery based on an open Site Logistics Task, using the web services QuerySiteLogisticsTaskIn and ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn.

Scenario:

  1. We run the Outbound Delivery Requests MDR, which creates tasks from the Delivery Proposal screen.

  2. We use the QuerySiteLogisticsTaskIn web service to retrieve relevant task information before confirmation.

  3. We then attempt to confirm a partial release via ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn — for example, confirming 10 cases out of 20 for a specific Product ID with a given Batch ID.

The issue:
I expected the system to automatically generate an outbound delivery for the confirmed 10 cases, but no outbound delivery has been created so far.

SAP Support feedback:
We have already opened a similar case with SAP Support, and their conclusion was:

"After much deliberation and deep analysis, we can conclude that this web service (ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn) is intended to support the creation of an outbound delivery only when the full quantity of the pick task is confirmed. The web service does not support creation of an outbound delivery for partially confirmed quantities.
Although the system allows you to manually generate multiple outbound deliveries for a single pick task using the Late Delivery Split functionality through the SAP User Interface, this feature is not supported through the web service.
This limitation exists because the web service is designed to create an outbound delivery only after full quantity confirmation and does not support automatic handling of late delivery split.
We have analyzed the technical feasibility of implementing this functionality via the web service, but it is currently not possible."

My questions to the community:

  1. Has anyone found a feasible workaround for this limitation?

  2. How can we best handle the remaining deviation of the open task (partial quantities) through automation if the standard web service does not support it?

I’ve attached a screenshots of the task for reference.

The payload request of ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn:

The payload response of ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn:

The result in SAP - partial confirm of 21186 task:

No outbound delivery for 4537 sales order after performing partial confirm for task 21186:

 

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

entry.title: Yard Order API method does not update field 'WEIGHT'
entry.content:
Hi All,

We created a Yard Order with products at the item level using the API /SAPYL/CL_API_YARD_ORDER.

When attempting to update the Yard Order items from the Freight Order (sending loading instructions), we encounter the following errors:

Field WEIGHT cannot be changed since it is read-only.
Field TARE_WEIGHT cannot be changed since it is read-only.
Field VOLUME cannot be changed since it is read-only.
Field LENGTH cannot be changed since it is read-only.

We are currently on release 500. The available SAP Notes I have found are relevant only for earlier releases (200 and 400):

  • 2646482 – Yard Order API method does not update field WEIGHT

  • 2991727 – Yard Request can’t be updated from external system (TM or ERP) (Release 400)

Is there a solution on release 500?
